Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a hotel in the middle of Madrid and very close to metro station, to have a nice room cleaned every day, with large beds where you can rest after one day of visiting, with hospitable staff you definitely must choose IBIS MADRID CENTRO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 1 minute walking distance from Bilbao metro station. Grand Via is 10 minutes, Plaza del Sol is 15 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The area is residential area for locals. There is Starbucks and OpenCor supermarket close to the hotel where you can shop and drink coffee. The hotel has free wifi for customers. If you miss the last metro at 00:00, you can walk from Grand Via to the hotel, the area is very safe. Great Location, so stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cost-Benefit”
Reviews.Author: Christian R
Reviews.Content: Very well located, next to Bilbao Metro Station, in a street with many bars and pubs, quiet during day and night. Friendly staff, clean hotel. Shower door did not close wifi was not free (5 EUR p day). I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Ibis, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here at the weekend. Bilbao station is 2 minutes to the hotel. And hotel is 15 minute walk down the main shopping street to the city centre. In the neighborhood are many bars, and restaurants so great for a night out. Checkin was very friendly, even got an early checkin which was nice. Room is a standard Ibis room, perfectly clean and comfortable. You get what you pay for. Had a street facing room, but no noise issues whatsoever. had breakfast next morning, good standard buffet, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: cruicad
Reviews.Content: Booked on line for an overnight stay and it met the need at a reasonable (for Madrid) price. Our initial room was a smoking room (if there was an option on the website for a non smoking room I missed it). They were happy to change when asked but an option when booking would have been better. Room was clean and comfortable. Watch the bathroom floors as they are slippery. They do provide a floor mat in all fairness Breakfast was not included and we could have done better elsewhere but were pushed for time. The Bilbao subway station was only 30 meters or so away, although we did not use it. There is a Dia supermarket a couple of blocks away and it is a good chain in our limited experience and their home brand juice is way better than average. May be a better deal for breakfast if you are on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Nicely placed”
Reviews.Author: carlosochoa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen on the basis of being close to a metro station, and for a business trip. It is also a good base for exploring the city, as it is not in the heart of the "centro" (with all its ups and downs) but you can easily reach it, even walking. The hotel lobby is located on a higher floor, but there is a small cage elevator. Personnel is corteous and willing to help. Rooms, clean and efficient as in every Ibis, but beds detract from the value being paid. However, they are very silent, which is a plus on a street that has many bars and restaurants nearby. Internet wifi is adequately priced but could be free as in other hotels of the chain. Breakfast was the same choice every day, however it was adequately priced.

Reviews.Title: “A shame this property bears the Ibis logo”
Reviews.Author: Happy2BHomesick
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four in two rooms: three seniors and myself, in my thirties. I quickly parked the car in a spot in front of the hotel (it is almost impossible to park in front of the hotel - the closest parking available is one block away). The street is busy and I had to take our luggage to the sidewalk. My parents and my uncle called the reception from the intercom outside to ask for help with the luggage while I looked for a place to park. As I returned, twenty minutes later, they were standing on the sidewalk, freezing cold, with our luggage. No one had come out to help them. I took our luggage to the reception myself and SURPRISE, the ONLY elevator available in the hotel was out of order. So I had to climb two floors carrying our own luggage. The elevator was out of order twice during the week we stayed there and my family had to use the stairs with a lot of difficulty. My mother, once, felt too weak to climb the stairs, so she took a seat close to the front desk while we went upstairs to get our cameras. When we returned, my mother told us she had been told by the front desk to move to another chair because people who were checking in had PRIORITY to use the chairs closest to the front desk. For an Ibis, the hotel is a shame. Very cheap liquid soap in the room, very cheap towels (drenched after one use - and often had to call the front desk to get dry towels because the cleaning staff did not change them), no safe in the room, no extra pillows (it was an exercise of patience to get two extra pillows for each room), heating didn't heat as expected. The overall cleanliness of the rooms also fell below our expectations. The front desk was always unhelpful and seemed to be bothered by the guests who approached them with questions. This was my fourth stay in Madrid, the first one in this hotel. I love the city and never expected such awful service associated with the Ibis chain. Honestly, if you're looking for an inexpensive hotel do a little more research and you will find dozens of other options (some of which are better located than this one). This hotel and its service define very well the difference between being inexpensive and being "cheap" with a negative connotation. Really disappointing experience. About it being close to the sights in Madrid, it is a good 20/25 minute walk down a street to get to Puerta del Sol. And to reach the hotel at the end of the day, it's the same 25 minute walk but going up a slope. Seniors may feel discouraged to walk that much. The closest subway station (across the street) neither has escalators nor elevators. So, if you intend to get there by subway, you'll have to exit three or four blocks away from the hotel at a different station. For a tastier (and worthier of your money) breakfast, try the Starbucks around the corner or some other nice pastry shops around the hotel. We had prepaid our whole stay, otherwise we would have definitely gone to another hotel nearby. Do a little more research and do not let your first contact with beautiful Madrid be tainted by the cheap service of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Graham G
Reviews.Content: Ibis hotel in Madrid was very good, very nice place and everywhere in Madrid is easily accessible from the location of the hotel. The room was nice and clean and satisfied our needs in general, very basic but we didnt need anything more, we were always out and about in Madrid so just used the hotel as a rest area really. Madrid is beautiful and you feel right in the mix in this hotel, right in the heart of a typical Spanish capital area, which is exactly what we wanted! The metro station is very close by too, so its easy to get about from here. I would recommend it, just dont stay in your room long..get out and see Madrid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Steve5013Bristol
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome, good size room and very accessible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to take in beautiful Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DorianneNoel
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days at Ibis hotel with my boyfriend where we could enjoy a view portraying a part of the city life of the beautiful Malasana-area. Our room, which was on the top floor, was spacious, with a 'large' bathroom' and a dainty sofa-bed in the corner. If I were to change anything it would probably relate to the daily cleanling service and the availability of at least an extra towel per person. Breakfasts at the hotel costs Eur6.50 per person and was quite abundant. From day to day, choice of food items varied; there were a couple of times where we had to do without some items that were missing but on the whole breakfast was ok. Looking back, we still think the location of the hotel could not have been any better, the main attractions of central Madrid are within walking distance. And if you get tired of walking, there's always 'Bilbao' metro station which is a minute away from the hotel! :) Dorianne and David Malta

Reviews.Title: “Nice one-night stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night on a business trip and had a nice experience. The room was clean and comfortable, the shower was very powerful and in a separate cubicle (not over the bath tube), and the breakfast was surprisingly good. The hotel location is handy, with lots of restaurants around; the hotel itself has no lounge area, only restaurant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to locate in Madrid and not too far from the centre areas. The overall standard of the hotel was good. Only bad part was that there was a bit of noise from the street on Saturday night but otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and in a super location”
Reviews.Author: Shawlands
Reviews.Content: Our overall rating of this hotel is based on its excellent location near Bilbao Metro and the 338 eur we paid for a 4 night stay. There were some hiccups while we were there however. When we opened the door of the room we had been allocated, we discovered that someone else was using the room. The bed had not been made up and there were clothes lying around. The receptionist gave us another room but was adamant there should not have been anyone in the first room., Perhaps the hotel has a resident ghost! There is a reasonable selection at the breakfast buffet but on two of the days several things had run out and there did not seem much of a rush to replace them. Surely it's not too much to ask to be able to get a cup of coffee or a bread roll! The staff on reception seemed to be responsible for looking after the breakfasts and were not able to do so when the desk was busy. The hair drier in the bathroom did not work and the shower gel dispenser was empty. We were also asked to pay for breakfast on our last morning which we had already prepaid for. We have taken this up with Accor's booking site and are awaiting a response. Despite the hotel's shortcomings we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Ibis experience”
Reviews.Author: Maril_11
Reviews.Content: Very good location but unfortunately noisy, like many hotels in Madrid. I got a room in top floor so there was not so much noise from the bars and the smaller street. However, on the other side, there is a main road with heavy traffic even in the night and ambulances woke me up several times in the night. The room was just the basic Ibis style - all the basic stuff but nothing extra. The bed was to firm for my taste. Nice restaurants and shops nearby, easy connection to airport by metro. The personnel at reception were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Centro, A center for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: rasoul_nikkhah
Reviews.Content: With a great location in center of the city and adjacent to the old town, Ibis Centro gives you a unique opportunity to walk your way out in the historic neighborhood although you are just a heartbeat away from the Bilbao metro station. Friendly staff and soothing ambience makes your stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent piece of business”
Reviews.Author: ravenx8
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel with my wife and the only thing that I can say is that it's an excellent piece of business! Low fares and an excellent location, where you can walk to the center (20 minutes) or take the subway, that is located at 50 meters and take 5 minutes to Sol, the city center. With this price, I would say that is one of the best options to know Madrid on a low budget!

Reviews.Title: “Average....”
Reviews.Author: lorelei34
Reviews.Content: but very expensive, in my opinion. We payed 110 euro/night with breakfast included for 2 persons. We've been for there 2 nights, 17 and 18 august, exactly when the pope was there and the hall JMJ huliganism.... I planned my vacation since march, of course I didn't know then that the pope will come. We wouldn't have gone!!!! The only "good" thing was that the room had a separate bed for my child ( 5 years old), so we slept ok. The elevator is very slow and breakfast is a joke. We literally didn't have what to eat. And we payed extra breakfast for the child. We could have bought him a sandwich, it would have been cheaper. Breakfast: bread, slices of cheese, slices of ham, butter, jam, some fruits, some yogurts, cereals and coffe and juice. That was all!!!! Not even a boiled egg!!!! However, we were very pleased with the front-desk lady, who was very helpful. They don't have food in the hotel, although the sign with 24 hours snacks is very big. Only slices of pizza which is not very good. The explanation was that there are many restaurants around. Actually, there are not so many and they are with specific foods. The good thing is that the hotel is close to the metro station Bilbao, but it's a very big mistake to take the metro from airport. I didn't understand why there was the complaint about the metro... now I do. We had 4 trolleys, we were tired, there were lots of spots where you have to carry them on the stairs!!!! However, if you decide to take the metro, the easiest way is to take line 8 from the airport only until the Mar de Cristal station ( not to the end of the line) and then change to line 4 and go directly to Bilbao. The journey is longer, but is better than change 2 times ( how we did) and it's cheaper: 2,50 instead 3 ( because line 10 it's in another zone). When you exit the airport, at the information point, take maps of the metro and of Madrid ( they are free and you need them). Be careful if you leave from terminal T4S!!!! The check-in is at terminal T4 (RIDICULOUS!!!!!!) and only then take the train from terminal T4 to T4S. If you want to go to Plaza Mayor, the easiest way with the metro is: take line 4 from Bilbao to Alonso Martinez ( one station) , then line 5 to Opera Station. It's the easiest way. If you want the closest El Corte Ingles, take line 1 directly from Bilbao to Sol station. Madrid is a very nice city ( we've been here before), but if you want to visit a lot of places, it's better to take the metro instead of walking because it's very hot in the summer and it can be crowded on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok, however few improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel for 2 nights. Room was clean, however there was bed smell coming from bathroom/toilet. Towels were old, but clean and changed every day. Slow and only one elevator. Very close to underground/metro and city center! Breakfast: One week before we've visited Ibis in Barcelona (Pz. Glories) and there is big difference between them in this particular matter. Here was small variety of food and tomatoes pulp was only on one day. However, overall, met my excpectations - value/money - OK

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: coolbreeze99999
Reviews.Content: The IBIS Madrid Centro is ideally located for your trip to Madrid. The hotel is just two minutes walk from the Metro and all of the stations for the main sites are a few stops away. The Metro is clean, tidy and safe. We never waited more that 4 minutes for a train and at 1 Euro a trip is a bargain (London could learn from the Metro). The area surrounding the hotel was fine with plenty of shops and bars. The hotel is clean and tidy, breakfast OK and rooms are typical IBIS (and typical IBIS good value) but let's face it you don't come to Madrid for the rooms do you? The best feature about the IBIS is the fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so rude and uncaring we actually didn't stay at all in the end”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very tired after an overnight bus trip and had stayed at a couple of Ibis Hotels in Portugal and Morocco so decided we would head straight here. The staff were rude and unhelpful and quoted a price higher than we'd seen on their website so we didn't bother and went and found somewhere else that was cheaper and had the most delightful and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dbegley03
Reviews.Content: Great location just off C/ Fuencarral, close to supermarkets and 15 minute walk to centre (Gran Via) and 1 minute walk to metro stop Bilbao. Plenty of cafes/bars/restaurants along the way. Hotel is spotless, rooms are basic but functional and cleaned thoroughly every day. Staff could not be more pleasant and service was excellent. Breakfast for €6.50 per person, fresh bread, pastries, ham, cheese, cereal, yogurts and fruit, excellent value. Would definitely use this hotel again, great base for a fantastic stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcatsbeds
Reviews.Content: A convenient, central location but rooms a very small and there is a lot of late night noise from surrounding streets.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great staff. For a 2 star Ibis, central to Madrid. Build another one! Just read they need 200 characters to fill this review but I don't have 200 friends even! .................................................

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: lordofflies
Reviews.Content: Perfect location,and a VERY FRIENDLY STAFF!! Reception excellent,breakfast little poor, roomrate unbeatable.Madrid became one of my favorites...

Reviews.Title: “Middle Class but little budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmeyer
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quit small, but you can not expect luxury from a budget hotel. Service, rooms and the hotel lobby- everything was OK. Breakfast was very poor, if you compare what you get in Asia for example.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and no frills”
Reviews.Author: docrkd
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on a stag - clean, comfortable bed good hot shower in an excellent location on a lovely street with plenty of bars etc note - noisy with the windows open and they have no rooms with twin beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK second time round”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: Continuing my theme from the last review, the hot water supply at this hotel was OK. Not a good flow and not as hot as I would like. Interesting as it's a sister hotel (slightly lower grade) to the hotel I wrote about last week (Mercure). Staff make such a difference and this, second trip, made me realise that two of the staff on reception could do with what used to be called 'Welcome Host' in UK tourist board circles! On the other hand, Alberto (reception) and Olga (breakfasts) are delightful. It's Spain, so I am not complaining... merely making an observation... that noise from the street does last into the early hours (even with the window shut). The rooms are OK but shower fittings beginning to show signs of wear and tear - see photographs of hose and non-closing shower door.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, offers a good room and good breakfast for a reasonble price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Naveen13
Reviews.Content: The IBIS Madrid Centro is very well connected by metro and that is one of the major plus points. Infact 2 different tube stations are located close by and that makes travel around Madrid relatively easy. Coming back to the hotel, its quite decent, rooms are well furnished. But on the whole you still feel that the hotel is quite cramped and so is the lobby area and as well as the elevators. But on the whole decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi, The room had the AC pre-configured to heating and during the day, the heat was high. I had to open windows, with the problem of high noyse. The bathroom had a bad smell during the whole stay, despite being cleaned. The breakfast was good. A homellet, sframbled eggs would be nice addition. The entrance is difficult for those with heavy luggage. Internet/WiFi should be free, as it is in most of the hotels these days...

Reviews.Title: “hi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i am apreciated of accor group hotels because in madrid ibis hotel i had everythings verey good near to metro station near to shopping clean room good servise for everything only 5 euro for wifi for a day with verey good speed and verey good reception persons thats were verey mercifully and them could speak to english good i like this hotel and if i wana come in madrid this hotel is my first choice

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius_Morais
Reviews.Content: Very nice. As any other Ibis, clean and very reasonable prices. But this one is about 5 min from Puerta del Sol by subway !! And the subway station is at half-block walk. Very good localization. Strongly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Go, you wont regret it!”
Reviews.Author: itsnotlupus
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel following the various views shared here and i have to say i wasn't disappointed at all. my flight was delayed so we didnt arrive until after the metro system closed down for the night (1.30am) and consequently had to get a taxi (35 euro's for 25 min but we were stuck behind dustcarts for 10 mins). i was expecting an unhelpful / half asleep receptionist but was instead greeted by a pleasant and helpful chap who didn't seem to realise that it was 3.30 am and most sane people would be asleep not checking in and asking for a drink from the bar, both of which were done with ease and a smile. as for the location, i really can't see why you'd want to go anywhere else. the metro stop (bilbao) is literally a couple of minutes amble to the end of the road and the metro system itself is a breeze (and remarkably clean) altough i would suggest walking if you can as everything is pretty close and easy to get to. my wife and i decided for a stroll on our first morning to see what the local area was like and to get our bearings and thought the immediate vicinity was ok without being anything special but did seem to have a good selection of places to eat. when we arrived back later the area seemed to have a bit more of a buzz to it and then by 9pm it was transformed. it seemed that every other residence was either a bar or restaurant (try nina's just down the road, lovely food!!) and the place was lively and busy. however, despite this, it never got too noisy and we never felt uncomfortable or uneasy whilst out and about. on returning to our room we were pleasantly suprised how quiet it was considering what was going on in the street, you could still hear some noise but not enough to disturb us (it might be a problem if you are a light sleeper though). the room itself was basic but clean and comfortable, ideal for anyone just needing a bed for the night and not much else. the breakfasts ( 6.5 euro's each )were more than adequate and whilst there wasn't an amazing choice, everything was fresh, tasty and replenished (we even asked for some more at 11.50 when they are supposed to stop serving at midday and were not made to feel as if we had asked them to slaughter their first born as you can get in some hotels! ) indeed, throughout our stay all the hotel staff we saw were pleasant and helpful. all in all i was very pleased with the hotel, it was cheap, easy to get to, close to bars and restaurants without being rowdy, clean and comfortable. the only possible complaint i could have was that this was the first time i'd taken sole charge of all the arrangements and bookings when going away with my wife and it went so well i think i'm going to have to do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly As Hoped - PERFECT for me!”
Reviews.Author: granvisconti
Reviews.Content: I stay in "high" and "low" hotels - for work, always 5 star, but when travelling on my own (or "roughing it") I almost always look for ACCOR Hotels! Great location, clean rooms, and EXCELLENT VALUE! On previous visits to Madrid, I have stayed in Room Mate properties or ME Madrid -great "destination" modern hotels, with postcard views from my window, but at 3 times the price of IBIS. This visit was planned at the last minute, over a European holiday weekend; as a result, the usual places were booked or more than twice the price of my usual bookings. I knew which area(s) I wanted to stay in, and was a little apprehensive about the location (as I had not really "strayed" as far north as Bilbao fountains). WOW! A great location in Madrid for this visit - convenient to the areas where I was spending the majority of my time, but far enough from the rowdy holiday crowds I encountered until early in the AM. FOR ME - Huge room. - Location!!!! Everything from shopping (adjacent to Fuencaral, a main retail corridor that goes all the way thru Chueca to Sol), dining (Cafe Colonial across the street for "traditional Madrid" breakfasts, with tons of restaurants along same street as hotel), transportation (Metro across the street: from airport, only 2 euro, and FAST) and nightlife (located at the far north of Chueca, where the majority of clubs and bars are located) - PRICE!!!! - added novelty of staying on the street named for the "matir" who started the French/Spanish riots of 1808, on the anniversary of the uprising. Kinda neat :) BUT.... - not for a luxury traveller - VERY basic rooms, with futon-like "matress" - not for someone wanting Burger King for every meal - not for the evening "early birds" (my neighbors were all coming back to their rooms around 10, as I would be going out for dinner!); Madrid can have very late-nights, with people in the streets until 2 or 3 every night. Even though this is more "residential", there can still be late-night noise that may disturb children or light-sleepers - it is a little bit of a hike to the "museum triangle", Sol, or even Gran Via. Although the Metro is on the corner, the main "turisitic" sights are about a 20-30 minute walk. I really love the neighborhood - quiet enough to give the "feeling" of Madrid, without as much of the hubub of Gran Via. Again, I often stay in Motel 6 when travelling the USA, because of PRICE & LOCATION. If you want the Ritz - stay there. I will definitely stay again when looking for the best-priced rooms in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Bargain”
Reviews.Author: SAC-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: Madrid—Ibis Madrid: I didn’t like this hotel at first. It was impossible to find when getting out of the Metro. Admittedly, that’s partly my fault, because I didn’t print the map. But it’s just as much the Ibis Hotels’ fault. The map on one of their official websites did not name the Metro stop, much less mention which of the six exits to choose. When traveling with a now frustrated partner, and you both have heavy luggage that must be carried up a flight and a half of stairs to get out of the station, that’s key information. Worse, one of those six exits is half of a block from the hotel. Few people we asked knew about the hotel, it’s not marked on any of the maps in the Metro station, and when we finally did get near the hotel, its entrance is nearly impossible to find. Unlike most hotels, this hotel has a simple, single door underneath the vertical sign—defiinitely not a typical hotel entrance. Furthermore, the street entrance is one level below the registration desk, and there’s only a stair and a tiny freight elevator to reach it. So I wasn’t exactly a happy traveler when I checked in. But the perky front desk agent got past my admittedly sour attitude, and the room—while basic (especially in contrast to our rooms in Barcelona and Valencia)—was comfortable, had a great bathroom, and had free Internet. After we recovered our happy moods, we went exploring and realized that the hotel was in a good location, about a 20-minute walk from the Gran Via, and another 10- to 15-minute walk from the historic Plaza Mayor, a half of a block from the Metro station, and had a number of restaurants nearby, including a terrific Peruvian restaurant and a local chain restaurant we liked—Vips (whom we learned owns the Starbucks operation in Spain and Portugal). One drawback to the location is that a theater is on the lower levels of the building and there are lots of clubs and restaurants nearby. That results, in turn, in a lot of street noise late at night. We had no difficulty sleeping, but we did hear the noise. Although we didn’t purchase it with our room, we took the ample and reasonably priced breakfast buffet each day. The guests, too, seemed like nice people from all over Europe and the UK. Although the lobby and breakfast area on the entry level seemed a bit compact, the staff had room to store our luggage on the last day of our visit, when we had to check out by noon but were not leaving for the train station until 5 pm. In fact, the staff was always kind and helpful, and provided knowledgeable tourist information about the sites and the Metro system whenever we asked for it. I’ve not been an Ibis fan in the past. But I am now. All in all, this hotel offered a pleasant tourist class experience.

Reviews.Title: “In historic Calle Manuela Malasana”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the street which takes it's name from an historic figure, a woman accosted by two French soldiers during the occupation of Spain, at the time of the 1808 rebellion by locals. The facilities are as to be expected from Accor's Ibis chain, rooms of a decent size, shower rather than bath; only Spanish language television channels. Numerous reception staff encountered during four days and all multi-lingual. Downside: not all the food advertised on the succinct menu was available during my stay - not a problem unless you are tired and do not wish to find local establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Evandstace
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Madrid is right near the Bilbao metro station and nice and central to the city. Plenty of restaurants, Pubs and shopping are close by. The rooms are quite large and fitted in the basic Ibis style. Our room was clean and comfortable it had an LCD TV with around 30 channels but only one English speaking, Sky News. A 24 hour menu is available if you’re still thirsty or get the late night munchies. The reception staff are very friendly and are happy to help you with any info you require. Breakfast is available for 6.50 Euro and is basic but fulfilling, it’s served till midday which helps if you have a late night! We would definitely recommend this hotel as a cheap, clean and central option in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel...excelent location.”
Reviews.Author: BlopaRio
Reviews.Content: A very nice budget hotel in the center of Madrid. New and clean. Ibis tipical hotel. Location is excelent in a nice and safe area. Beatiful street with a lot of really good restaurants and bars, not only for tourists. (recomend the bar Maravillas, with nice tapas and beers) Close to Bilbao metro and FueCarral street with lots of stores, bars and a supermarket. It´s only 15 mins walking from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Rooms are small but very clean, nice bed, good bathroom with nice shower. Breakfast is basic and not inclued. Wi Fi internet acess is expensive. The staff is small but provides the basics services as maps, local information and taxi arrange. Don´t expect luggage carring, room service or any other special service.

Reviews.Title: “Good.. As expected for Ibis”
Reviews.Author: AP_Russia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days with my bride for a honeymoon in Spain. We have chosen Ibis because of its location and well-known standards of rooms, staff, breakfast, etc. And everything were 100% as expected. Very friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast with usual cornflakes, sausages, etc. Good clean rooms. The location is quite convenient (well, you cannot get to the city centre on foot but a Bilbao metro station is in close proximity). So I would advice this hotel to all types of travellers if you can get a good room rate for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girl friend for 4 nights and had wonderful time. This is a very typical İbis Hotel. Because it was very new it was not yet worn down. We chose this hotel because it was 60€ a night and we had no intention whatsoever to spend time at the hotel other than sleeping at night. If you want to spend time at the hotel and relax, this is not a good choice. Try the Petit Palace chain. Rooms were typically were moderate. Looks like a good university dormitory. The best bet of this hotel aside the price is its location. A few meters away from the Bilbao Metro station you can reach anywhere you like in town in less than 10minutes. The hotel is situated in an area where you can find dozens of cozy bistros and cervecerias.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Ljunior82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis Madrid centro for 5 nights in march this year, I think it would be impossible to find a more convenient place to stay for the same price. Don't expect nay luxury or sofisticated services, all you get is no more than the Ibis standard, which for me was more than enough, considering I was in a great city that is Madrid, full of things to do and places to go. The hotel is just a few steps away from the Bilbao metro station, it's located in the heart of Madrid, just a 20 minutes walk to the Gran Via. The staff is made of young and friendly people who speak english and is aways willing to help you either to find a place to go or on how to get a bus to go anywhere. The Ibis Madrid Centro hotel really contributed to make my stay in Madrid as nice as it could be. The only thing I missed was a safe in the room

Reviews.Title: “Centre, Centre, CENTRE Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Valinhas
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for its location (I'm suspect because I lived very near for 6 months!). Right at Tribubal/Malasaña barrios, with one of the most busy nightlife ambiences of Madrid. Door yes, door no, you'll find a bar or a restaurant to drink some copas. Right in front, to good references: Molly's (Irish Pub) as well as Nina (excellent restaurant). You even have a theatre side-by-side. A 2 minutes walk lead you to Plaza 2 de Mayo, or to the metro station of Bilbao. Excellent prices (100€ with breakfast per night) on a weekend. Turn-off: they don't allow late check-outs. Time limit is 13h/pm. Wi-fi: 12€ per 24h with Telefonica

Reviews.Title: “Standard Ibis, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Vitz6
Reviews.Content: Good location being 30 second walk from Bilbao Metro station and a 10 minute walk to Plaza Mayor. Coming from the airport was a 10-15 min cheap (1 euro) metro ride (1 change at Mar de Cristal). Was hard to find the entrance as it looked more like an emergency exit door rather than a standard hotal entrance. Distance to metro station cancels this out as a real gripe though. Room was small but not an issue for us being there for only 2 nights. Rooms well cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central and up to Ibis' usual standards”
Reviews.Author: Huddsguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for two nights to keep the cost of the trip down for a client. At €99 per night, the Ibis Madrid Centro is considerably cheaper than many of the other hotels in the city I researched. Located about 200m from the Bilbao metro station (Line 4 / 10 I think) the hotel is in a quiet side street above a theatre (don't let that put you off - I didn't hear a thing from the packed show running during my stay). The area is very safe and quite pleasant, with some decent looking eateries and bars nearby, as well as some shopping near the underground station. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk from the Gran Via / 20 minutes walk from Sol along a trendy / quite bohemian shopping street which made for an interesing stroll. The room met Ibis' usual standards and was clean, well presented and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and great value at €5.50. The only slight drawback was the fact that the lobby was accessible only by climbing a steep flight of stairs from street level or by using a rather slow and laborious wheelchair lift. Other than that, great for the business traveller and tourist alike.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: This hotel opened in September 2007 and the lobby and rooms are immaculate. The room was very comfortable and was a decent size. The bathroom was well laid out and spotless. Instead of carpet, the rooms have laminate wood floors which I'm sure are much easier to keep clean. Ibis hotels are not luxury hotels but do offer decent accommodation for a reasonable price. This hotel as on a small street about 100 meters from the Metro. There are also plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly and all seemed to speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: billingw
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and inexpensive, but it lacked some basics. For example: no washcloths, tissues, clock, hairdryer, internet access (available for 12€ per day!), etc. The decor was very Ikea-like. The staff was very nice and helpful. Many restaurants are within a 5-minute walk. The location is good - you can walk to major tourist sites and the Bilboa metro is right there. We found it very easy to take the metro from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Like a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: GuinevereMurphy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based on its location and price, which both did turn out to be quite good. As other travelers have noted, there are a lot of nice places around the neighborhood (though my tastes were more towards the shopping and fun coffee/dessert shops and restaurants around, rather than the bars because I was six months pregnant at the time we stayed). I _might_ consider staying here again, but only if it were still under $100, and everywhere else in the center of Madrid was still around $200, as it was when we were there in June 2007, but I wouldn’t stay there pregnant again. My chief problem was the fact that, although everything was shiny and relatively new, it was all very, very cheaply constructed. The bed was a piece of plywood supported by two vertical pieces of plywood in an "X" configuration (if you know what I mean), so the support was all wrong, with a hard foam pad for a mattress. I found it so intensely uncomfortable that I could hardly sleep unless exhausted; my hips ache just thinking about that bed. I kept asking for pillows, and by the end of our three nights was using a layer of pillows on top of the mattress to try to soften it up. A lot of the pillows, though new, had small holes in their seams that leaked tiny square pieces of foam all over the room. The bathroom was gleaming new, but the shower stall (no tub) was already starting to fall apart due to the general shoddiness of construction: one side of the glass enclosure was starting to fall off at its base, meaning that I was afraid to touch the sides of the shower stall for fear of breaking something. The showerhead was nice, though (three speeds). A sewer smell did tend to waft out of the shower drain in the evenings, unfortunately, since I was spending a lot of my sleepless nights sitting in the bathroom reading so as not to wake my sleeping husband. My last complaint was regarding the floor: there was carpeting, but it was so thin that walking around barefoot, it felt more like walking on the concrete it was undoubtedly covering up, and also the “carpet” was more like felt fabric; although it was probably regularly vacuumed, it must have really sucked up dirt because my feet got black from walking around in the room barefoot. That was the only cleanliness issue I had with the place. One important good thing: it had really great air conditioning. I have to admit that all these complaints reflect the fact that I’m a pickier traveler than I used to be; when I was 20-25, I’m pretty sure I would have though this was a great place for the money. As it was, I’m 33 and pregnant, and although I really liked the price and location, I wasn’t crazy about anything else there except the air conditioner and its newness and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: BritBronco
Reviews.Content: Overall I was extremely pleased with my choice of this hotel. The location is outstanding, a stones throw from the Bilbao Metro station, and surrounded by several nice bars and restaurants. The hotel staff were very helpful, providing directions, putting up with our occasionally loud behaviour in the bar and also arranging a late check out. The rooms were of a good quality, decently sized with relatively spacious bathrooms, albeit with no baths (as you will generally find in continental Europe). There is a bar/restaurant in the lobby which didn't seem to be up to much and was relatively expensive, however there are many superior options in the surrounding bars and restaurants. We paid about £70 per room (Double bed and single bed per room), through lastminute, which wasn't payable until check out. This turned out to be the same as the normal rack rate. For a major European Capital City over Easter weekend, I thought this was good value for the location and quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: dagobrun
Reviews.Content: I'd suggest to stay here because it's well located,it's comfortable like the other Ibis hotels and the rooms are really big.Maybe it's just a bit expensive(even if apparently it was a good price for the average of Madrid)and moreover I didn't appreciate so much the attitude of the staff that sometimes has not been very polite to us.The other positive aspects are that the underground station "Bilbao"is just in front and you can easily reach the city centre even on foot if you prefer walking(about fifteen minutes)and besides you have many bars and nice restaurants around
